div.div: εὐνή , gen. εὐνῆφι: (1) place to lie, bed, couch; said of an army, Il. 10.408; of the ‘lair’ of wild animals, Il. 11.115; esp. typical of love and marriage, φιλότητι καὶ εὐνῇ, οὐκ ἀποφώλιοι εὐναὶ | ἀ̄θανάτων, Od. 11.249.—(2) pl., εὐναί, mooring-stones, which served as anchors, having cables (πρυμνήσια) attached to them, and being cast into the water or upon the shore, Il. 1.436, 476.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
